R: @charlesccychen @aaltay
fyi, the java SDK dropped explicit support for the additional flags like service account name, service account key file and always just defaults to application default credentials.
@lukecwik thanks, yes we have cleanup planned for this pretty soon. Right now this PR unblocks datastoreio.

Refer to this link for build results (access rights to CI server needed): 
https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PreCommit_Java_MavenInstall/5379/
--none--

The problem is the `--user travis` argument that we pass to `pip`. The proper argument is only `--user`, without a username. `pip` interprets `travis` as a new package to install.

Previously, `travis` was a valid PyPi repository, so it was installed, and the script ran properly ([see here for an old successful run installing the travis package](https://travis-ci.org/apache/incubator-beam/jobs/169343346#L207)).

r: @aaltay
I've squashed the commits, so the travis run was relaunched, but you can see that here is my most recent succesful run in [Linux](https://travis-ci.org/apache/incubator-beam/jobs/180215248#L230) and [Mac](https://travis-ci.org/apache/incubator-beam/jobs/180215247#L95). In both cases things run properly.

@pabloem, this is great. Thank you. LGTM.

Any idea why mac was working? Is it because tox was already installed on the Travis images and that `pip install` command was not executing at all?

Refer to this link for build results (access rights to CI server needed):

I'll wait for the current tests to run and then ask a committer to merge.

+R: @peihe

LGTM! (the move, that is)

Should `WindowedValue` maybe also be in `runners.core`? It's not directly exposed in the API and users can only query the contents using methods on `ProcessContext` or by having a window parameter on `@ProcessElement`.
Yes, I agree `WindowedValue` should also be in `runners.core`. @jkff has begun working towards this in #1260.

Shouldn't all snippets be tested?
This can now be closed.
@aaltay is this still LGTM?
@charlesccychen  please close.
The test for BigQuery is a no-op. https://github.com/apache/incubator-beam/blob/python-sdk/sdks/python/apache_beam/examples/snippets/snippets_test.py#L473 so I think we just don't run a BQ unittest.

I think if we're going to cache the `DoFnInvoker` then we need to - otherwise we're caching the invoker but never reusing it, and this doesn't get us anything. I'm not sure how I feel about that - on one hand, it could reduce the number of methods we expose on `DoFnRunners` - but constructing a new instance of `DoFnInvoker` should be cheap, so I don't know if there's much to be gained from doing so.

@kennknowles @bjchambers @peihe might have preferences as well

Refer to this link for build results (access rights to CI server needed): 
https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PreCommit_Java_MavenInstall/5412/
--none--

I'm pretty certain this is because the BigQuery source is storing a link to the services object, and that contains mocks which are not serializable. We worked around this for Bigtable by using a `SerializableFunction` that generates the services at runtime: https://github.com/apache/incubator-beam/blob/master/sdks/java/io/google-cloud-platform/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/io/gcp/bigtable/BigtableIO.java#L291
Alternately, other tests in the file use a *fake* instead of a *mock*. @peihe may be able to shed more light here.

Commits squashed. Jenkins build passing too.

This is essentially what this PR is all about - unifying the execution of batch and streaming pipelines in terms of `SparkPipelineResult` semantics.

By using a `Future`  in `SparkRunner#run()` any exceptions thrown as part of starting a pipeline, be it `batch` or `streaming`, can be propagated to `SparkPipelineResult#waitUntilFinish()` in much the same way.

Makes sense?

I think unified-execution is indeed the essence of this PR, and that's great because it actually solves 2 or 3 open issues.
My question is about the implementation, for example: could the `ExecutorService` in `SparkRunner` be only a part of `SparkPipelineResult.BatchMode` ? and so `SparkPipelineResult.StreamingMode` is non-blocking by Spark's nature.

WDYT ?

And please add the relevant issues this PR addresses to the title, for example: `[BEAM-123, BEAM-456] Title`.
Thanks,
